intro: Newcastelia elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leafed Newcastelia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid gardens.
